New Records: Dejounte Murray recorded a triple-double with 14 points, 12 assists, and 10 rebounds, marking his 20th career triple-double.
Key Match Events: New Orleans Pelicans scored 17 consecutive points at the end of the first quarter and the start of the second, giving them a 36-22 lead which they never relinquished.
Pre-Game Insights: New Orleans Pelicans had dropped 11 in a row before winning the two games against the Wizards, moving them past the Wizards in the standings.
Post-Match Reflections: Washington Wizards were without Jordan Poole (left hip) and Bilal Coulibaly (illness), and Zion Williamson (left hamstring) and Brandon Ingram (left ankle) were also absent for the Pelicans.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Wizards' Alex Sarr had 18 points and 11 rebounds, while Yves Missi of the Wizards had 16 points and seven rebounds, both contributing significantly despite the loss.
Others: The game was played at Capital One Arena in Washington, DC, with a crowd of 15,451 attendees.
